summary: This is an email chain from December 2008 between Jay Lefkowitz, an attorney at Kirkland & Ellis, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein. The AUSA inquires if Lefkowitz will attend a meeting with someone named Roy, and Lefkowitz declines.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: The sender/recipient of the emails, identified as an attorney at Kirkland & Ellis. He declines an invitation to a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Roy
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the Assistant U.S. Attorney is having a meeting with on Thursday, which Jay Lefkowitz is invited to attend.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain and the planned meeting between the Assistant U.S. Attorney and Roy.

connections.description: Lefkowitz, an attorney at Kirkland & Ellis, is communicating about a meeting regarding Epstein, suggesting a legal or advisory relationship.
The AUSA is planning a meeting with Roy, indicating a professional association, likely related to the Epstein case.
They are communicating via email regarding a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein, indicating professional correspondence between defense and prosecution.

events.title: Planned Meeting about Epstein
events.description: A meeting scheduled for a Thursday (implied to be December 4, 2008, based on email date) between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and an individual named Roy, which attorney Jay Lefkowitz was invited to but declined to attend.

locations.name: West Palm Beach, FL 33401
locations.context: Location listed in the Assistant U.S. Attorney's email signature, indicating their office location.

keyFacts: In December 2008, an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach was coordinating a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein with someone named Roy.
Attorney Jay Lefkowitz of Kirkland & Ellis was invited to this meeting but declined to attend.
The email includes a standard Kirkland & Ellis confidentiality disclaimer, indicating legal privilege for the communication.
The communication shows ongoing legal activity and coordination regarding the Epstein case in late 2008.
